title: Operate webserver setup for test purposes
body:
It has been mentioned repeatedly that setting up the necessary environment for a particular test can be much more demanding that the actual test implementation. The leads to less tests being implemented, and implemented test to run less often then desired.

I would appreciate if we could host a series of HTTP server(s) (virtual hosts), something like `ci-test-<scenario>.datalad.org` that are available to test against a number of predefined scenarios.

Their availability would be beneficial for the RIA-related functionality. With all other supported "services" we have deployments to test against, not for RIA. All is done adhoc, and nowhere complete enough.

I would appreciate your feedback on how this could be achieved. A preconfigured container might be a possibility (to keep it within the context of a CI and always fresh). But a static deployment is also an option.
